thread.title: Area champions Northgate, East Coweta enter 1st round as heavy favorites
thread.title_full: Area champions Northgate, East Coweta enter 1st round as heavy favorites

title: Area champions Northgate, East Coweta enter 1st round as heavy favorites
text:
Area champions Northgate, East Coweta enter 1st round as heavy favorites by Comments 
East Coweta and Northgate’s volleyball teams enter the GHSA State Tournament tonight with something in common. 
Both lineups captured their respective region championships last Saturday and head into the first round as No. 1 seeds in respective Class and tournaments. 
East Coweta (20-20) plays host to Tucker (3-18) in today’s best-of-three match at 6 p.m. Tucker made into the playoffs despite a losing record after finishing as the fourth seed in Region 2- . 
The Lady Indians held off rival and top-seeded Newnan twice in last week’s 3- tournament, including a sweep in the best-of-five championship round (25-23, 25-22 and 25-18). 
The wins against the Lady Cougars avenged a loss to Newnan ear- lier this year in the Coweta County tournament. 
“I think we are more confident team than when we lost to them before,” East Coweta head coach Amber McClure said. “I have said since the beginning of the season, it is going to take time. We have two freshmen and three sophomores starting, so we just had to grow into it, and that is what the difference is right now.” 
A trio of seniors, Sydney Winters, Dominique Ingram and Peyton Smith have led the Lady Indians back to the playoffs. Sydney Winters leads the team with 290 kills and 199 digs, while Dominique Ingram has 274 kills and 80 blocks. Smith has 118 digs and 616 assists. Riley Padgett has 35 aces. 
With a win, East Coweta would advance to the Class Sweet 16 against North Gwinnett or Chattahoochee. 
Northgate’s confidence should be at a season-high after the Lady Vikings (26-18) won beat state-ranked opponents three times on the final of the 4- tournament including host McIntosh to capture an area title. 
The Lady Vikings, like East Coweta, takes on a No. 4 seed with a losing record in Druid Hills (4-10). 
Northgate is led by Taylor Richard with 298 kills and 184 digs. Katie Stanton has 230 digs. Delaney Surapine has leads the Lady Vikings with 318 assists. 
With a victory, Northgate would advance to the Class Sweet 16 against either Chapel Hill or Winder-Barrow. More
